intro: Sida rhombifolia var. afrorhomboidea, commonly known as African rhomboid sida, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in disturbed soils or along roadsides. This variant is noted for its adaptability and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
